p: Polyalthia bullata is a medicinal plant that belongs to the genus Polyalthia and family Annonaceae. It is a shrub species that has a single stem with thin branches covered with golden hairs as described by Global Information Hub on Integrated Medicine (GlobinMed) [ 1]. The plant has been reported to contain bioactive compounds such as alkaloids and flavonoids, which display anticancer activities towards leukemia and breast cancer [ 2, 3, 4]. In some countries, particularly in Malaysia, Thailand, and Indonesia, the plant has been used as an herbal aphrodisiac by the local citizens, apart from treating asthma, diabetes, waist pain, skin problems, high blood pressure, diabetes, and liver disease [ 5, 6, 7]. These medicinal potentials have led to massive exploitation of this plant from wild habitats, which can later lead to species extinction.
